bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to P.M. Hamer, January 31, 1942

div1.p: Hench sends Hamer a list of materials to be microfilmed and a check for the expense.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to P.M. Hamer, January 31, 1942
div1.opener:
January 31, 1942
Mr. P. M. Hamer
Director of Reference Service
The National Archives
Washington, D. C.
Dear Mr. Hamer:
div1.p:
I enclose a check for $28.78 for having
the material microfilmed which I personally chose on my
recent visit to the National Archives. The Mayo Clinic
Library has the Argus Microfilm Reader, Model 2, with
which usually 35 millimeter film is used, and the film
runs through horizontally.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
